class_notes:
Course Topic: Medieval and Renaissance Drama: Transgressive Women on Stage


In this course, which is designed to introduce you to key texts of premodern drama, we will focus on female representation in the works of Shakespeare's precursors and contemporaries. Through close reading and occasional film viewing, we will aim to make sense of a selection of English dramas written between the late fifteenth century and the early seventeenth century focusing on transgressive female characters and topics such as sexuality, race, reproduction, marriage, adultery, domestic violence, and revenge. Class work will emphasize close reading of these dramas within a variety of historical and cultural contexts and from a range of theoretical perspectives. Class expectations include active participation in discussion and regular writing, including research-based and multimodal assignments.
course_description: Representative medieval, Elizabethan, and Jacobean plays with some attention to the development of early English drama.
